items.content:
Horizon PPM is a next generation Project Portfolio Management system closing the gap between project delivery and executive decision makers.


Following live trials in large corporate environments we have a foundation to support early adopters and now need a full-stack developer to take the lead technical role and potentially CTO.


This role is expected to part-time/equity based for the remaining few months of this year whilst we close our first seed round and onboard the first major clients. During this period the focus will be on hands-on technical development with an option to progress to CTO as the business and team grows.


Tech Stack:



  • PHP Symfony

  • Python Django

  • Javascript/Jquery

  • AWS

  • Ubuntu Linux

  • Mysql

  • Bitbucket / Git


Non-Tech Skills:



  • Communication (this one can't be stressed enough!)

  • Structured & methodical, yet agile & flexible

  • Strong Integrity

  • Innovation & creative problem solving

  • Tenacious

  • Takes ownership

  • Resourceful

  • GSOH


Location: Remote. Plenty of Skype, Trello, Slack, etc. Ideally you'll be commutable to either London or the East Sussex coast for the rare times we want to get together face to face.


Compensation: Equity share for the right person


About Us: Currently more about me! I'm a solo founder with 30 years business experienced - and supported by an advisory team with a further 120 years I can lean on. Well connected in large enterprise environments in the UK and overseas. The next 6-12 months is going to be an adventure as things kick off.


Something Extra: Character and attiude will win the day, so applications welcomed from recent graduates or more mature candidates that may not have all the tech skills just yet but are prepared to put in the time to overcome this and rise to the challenge.


Process: I'm more interested in social media profiles than a CV. Then we'll talk.


Agencies: You'll be wasting your time chasing this one!

- JavaScript
- AppEngine and/or DataStore
- SQL/ MySQL
- Consumer facing web applicationsSo, if you are a Python Developer with AppEngine experience, please get in touch with me and apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed - therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

items.title: Remote Data Analytics/Data Statistics/Actuarial Scientist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=1, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
This full-time, permanent Data Analytics/Data Statistics/Actuarial Scientist career opportunity can be remote as the company is very employee-oriented and family-oriented.  If the successful candidate prefers to be onsite, that is also welcomed.  The company utilizes the very latest predictive, cloud-based technology to reduce risk exposure.  IoT (Internet of Things) and Artificial Intelligence are utilized. The company is growing and on a pace to triple its staff this year. The staff is team-oriented and highly collaborative. Employees are given leeway as to how they go about their day.  The company has a history of promoting from within.

 

The successful Data Analytics/Data Statistics/Actuarial Scientist will be responsible for the following:

  • Seeking case studies, behavioral reports and new learning from sensor data collection 
  • Seeking new learning from the collected data
  • Taking advantage of the increasing amount of data collected from the company's new products
  • Leveraging new data collection processes and sources
  • Developing and deploying innovative methods, models, and algorithms utilizing statistics, algorithms, data mining, and visualization
  • Anticipating, identifying and investigating data trends
  • Discovering actionable insights
  • Identifying business opportunities

 

Candidates will have a minimum background consisting of the following:

  • Must reside within a three hour drive of Madison, Wisconsin
  • Five years of experience
  • Strong ability to talk through findings and algorithms 
  • A four year degree in Statistics, Actuarial Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent
  • SQL relational database experience
  • Data visualization experience
  • Data analysis programming language experience
  • Statistical software experience
  • ETL knowledge

Preferred but not required backgrounds will include any of the following: 

  • Insurance industry experience
  • Tableau experience
  • Power BI experience
  • SQL Server experience
  • SSRS, Performance Point experience
  • Python experience
  • Algorithm  experience
  • AWS Cloud service experience EC2 experience
  • RDS experience S3 experience
